summary: Build an accounting app for an internet center to manage subscribers, monthly USD payments, packages, and billing totals.
architectural_notes: Currency is USD; billing cycle is monthly; track payments/due per month across a full year.
Include WhatsApp number field for subscriber contact/messaging reference.

existing_features.title: Build a frontend UI to manage subscribers: list/search subscribers, add/edit subscriber details (name, WhatsApp number, start date, package), and deactivate/reactivate subscribers.
In the subscriber details and subscriber list UI, provide a one-click WhatsApp action that opens a chat using the stored phone number via a wa.me link.
Build a monthly billing screen: select a year and month, view all active subscribers with their package, due amount (USD), and paid/due status; allow toggling paid status for that month.
Build a totals/reporting dashboard showing: (a) total required amount for the selected month (USD) and (b) a year summary total (USD). Include the business name 'TAHA @NET' in the app header.
Apply a consistent, coherent visual theme for the app UI (colors, typography, layout). Use a distinct style suitable for an internet center billing tool (avoid blue/purple).

new_feature_requests.summary: Subscriber management: store subscriber name/ID, subscription date, package, and WhatsApp contact number
Packages/pricing: define internet packages (e.g., 1MB = $5, 2MB = $10) in USD
Monthly billing tracking: monthly due amount per subscriber (USD) with month-by-month records across the year
Totals & reporting: calculate monthly required amount and overall totals (الإجمالي المجموع)
Create a backend data model and CRUD API for internet subscribers including: full name, WhatsApp phone number, subscription start date, selected package, and an active/inactive status.
Create a backend data model and API for internet packages priced in USD, pre-seeded with: Package '1MB' at $5/month and Package '2MB' at $10/month.

Implement monthly billing tracking per subscriber: for each subscriber and month (across a year), store whether the month is due and optionally whether it is paid, with the due amount auto-derived from the subscriber’s package price in USD.
Provide backend reporting endpoints to compute totals in USD: (a) total required amount for a selected month across all active subscribers, and (b) overall totals across a selected year.
